attributes.title: iPhone Supply Chain
attributes.description: This annotated map shows where the parts of the iPhone are manufactured and how it moves through the supply chain in order to create an iPhone.
Tantalum is an excellent conductor of heat and electricity. Therefore, tantalum is used in the electronics industry for capacitors and high power resistors. Tantalum is mined by men and machine.
attributes.title: 8. Tantalum

attributes.description: Rare Earths are minerals that are essential for making the iphone. They are many types of rare metals and they are used for creating different pieces of the iphone. They are mined by humans using big mining machines.
attributes.title: 1. Rare Earth

attributes.description: Coltan is mainly found in the eastern region of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Coltan becomes a heat resistant powder, which has properties for storing electrical charges. These powders are used in capacitors that control the current flow in cell phone circuit boards. Coltan is mined by hand by groups of men who dig by scraping off the surface mud from the rocks. A team can mine one kilo of coltan per day.
attributes.address: Mbandaka, Democratic Republic of the Congo
attributes.title: 7. Coltan

attributes.description: This is where the prototype of the iphone was created. The iphones created in factories all over the world are shipped here for approval. The Apple headquarters checks if the machine is in good quality for selling. The iphones that pass the test are then shipped to Apple stores all over the world to be sold.
attributes.title: 2. Apple Headquarters

attributes.description: The Apple Foxconn Factory is the biggest factory in which the iphone is created. About 300,000 workers work in this factory. This factory is in charge of assembly, creating, and shipping iphones. All the parts are assembled in this factory by machines and human hand. Then the iphones are shipped to the Apple Headquarters for approval to sell them.
attributes.title: 13. Apple Foxconn Factory

attributes.description: The radio module is a small electronic chip that is used to receive and send radio signals. This is used to make phone calls, use the internet, and play games wirelessly. These chips are made by machines in factories.
attributes.title: 11. Radio Modules

attributes.description: A touchscreen is a visual display that the user can use by touching and using certain gestures to operate certain tasks. Every operation on the iphone is given through the touchscreen. The touchscreen is made by melting glass, which is done by machines.
attributes.title: 12. Touch Screen

attributes.description: GPS, Global Positioning System, is a satellite navigation system that provides information on your location and time. This system is used for navigating users to different places. GPS chips are created by machines in factories.
attributes.title: 3. GPS

attributes.description: A camera module is an image sensor that is used in an iphone to take pictures and to change them digitally. The camera modules are created by machines in factories with few changes made by the human hand.
attributes.title: 9. Camera Module

attributes.description: The A4 processor is a system designed by Apple and is manufactured by Samsung. This chip is used for controlling the power efficiency of the device.
attributes.title: 10. A4 Processor

attributes.description: Flash memory is an electronic computer memory storage device that saves data, which can be erased, copied, and reprogrammed. The iphone uses this device to save music, apps, etc on the iphone. Flash memories are created in factories by machines.
attributes.title: 4. Flash Memory

attributes.description: Power management is a device that turns off the power of devices to a low-power state when it is inactive. It is used to make iphones go into sleeping mode when they are not in use. This is created by adding the power management program (created by humans who program this feature using computers) onto a chip that is made by machines.
attributes.title: 5. Power Management
6. Accelerometer
attributes.description: An accelerometer is a device that measures change in acceleration. It is used in an iphone to determine the iphone’s orientation. It is made by machines in a factory in Crolles.

attributes.title: Power Management to Apple Foxconn Factory
Flash Memory to Apple Foxconn Factory
A4 Processor to Apple Foxconn Factory
Camera Module to Apple Foxconn Factory
Touch Screen to Apple Foxconn Factory
Radio Modules to Apple Foxconn Factory
Apple Foxconn Factory to Apple Headquarters
6. Accelerometer to Apple Foxconn Factory
attributes.description:
An accelerometer is a device that measures change in acceleration. It is used in an iphone to determine the iphone’s orientation. It is made by machines in a factory in Crolles. 
"Watch How IPhone Accelerometers Work and Are Made." Watch How IPhone Accelerometers Work and Are Made. N.p., n.d. Web. 10 Feb. 2013.
